snippet: The Obama administration granted waivers on Thursday to six more states and the District of Columbia from key provisions of the No Child Left Behind education law.
abstract: Obama administration grants waivers to Arizona, Kansas, Michigan, Mississippi, Oregon, South Carolina and the District of Columbia from key provisions of the No Child Left Behind education law; states have agreed to implement new curriculum standards, evaluate teachers and principals based on their students’ progress on standardized tests, and focus on the bottom 5 percent of schools.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration granted waivers on Thursday to six more states and the District of Columbia from key provisions of the No Child Left Behind education law.

headline.main: Seven More Waivers Granted Under No Child Law
headline.print_headline: Seven More Waivers Granted Under No Child Law
